item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 24, 2024 at 5:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Adversarial Policies Beat Superhuman Go AIs (133 points | 44 comments)

3. JavaScript Benchmarking Is a Mess (67 points | 40 comments)

7. What happened to the world's largest tube TV? [video] (548 points | 249 comments)
8. E.W.Dijkstra: Simplicity is a great virtue ... complexity sells better. (104 points | 31 comments)
9. What would it take to add refinement types to Rust? (11 points | 1 comment)
10. Making AMD GPUs competitive for LLM inference (2023) (227 points | 136 comments)
11. Hoarder: Self-hostable bookmark-everything app (119 points | 23 comments)

13. Why are cancer guidelines stuck in PDFs? (217 points | 102 comments)
14. Automating the search for artificial life with foundation models (128 points | 19 comments)
15. Tokyo released point cloud data of the entire city for free (121 points | 9 comments)
16. Demystifying Debuggers, Part 2: The Anatomy of a Running Program (131 points | 17 comments)

19. Ask HN: Programmers who don't use autocomplete/LSP, how do you do it? (181 points | 384 comments)
20. Parsing millions of URLs per Second (2023) (124 points | 34 comments)
21. Show HN: Complete decompilation of Lego Island (205 points | 29 comments)
22. More men are addicted to the 'crack cocaine' of the stock market (115 points | 212 comments)
23. My Colleague Julius (378 points | 84 comments)
24. New research suggests that Walmart makes the communities it operates in poorer (19 points | 7 comments)
25. Return to NSA's Menwith Hill with 60 Minutes (2000) (5 points | discuss)
26. Xerox to acquire Lexmark (237 points | 206 comments)
27. Symbolic Execution by Overloading __bool__ (54 points | 7 comments)
28. National Cryptologic Museum (NSA/CSS) New Temporary Exhibit on Project Stargate (50 points | 19 comments)
29. Show HN: Llama 3.3 70B Sparse Autoencoders with API access (180 points | 43 comments)
30. Manx – a catalog of manuals for old computers (79 points | 16 comments)
